pluggable.name: Defensio
pluggable.author: Habari Community
pluggable.description: Provides the Defensio spam filter webservice to Habari comments.

help.value:
You will need an API key from defensio for the filter to work. Enter the API key Defensio gives you in the Configuration.

To help Defensio, make sure to change comments to spam before deleting them if they were not automatically marked as spam. This tells Defensio it made a mistake. The reverse is true as well: approving comments that Defensio think are spam informs Defensio.

Another way to help Defensio work better is to announce new blog posts you make. If you choose to announce posts to Defensio the following information is sent:

  • Author name and email
  • Article title and content
  • Permalink

Defensio assigns a 'spaminess' rating to all comments in addition to flagging them as spam or legitimate. You can choose the spaminess cutoff for comments marked as spam in Habari (but only comments flagged as spam by Defensio will be considered). Leaving it at 0% means that if Defensio thinks it is spam it will be marked as spam.

You can also choose a spaminess cutoff to automatically delete messages at. Anything flagged as spam with a spaminess at or above this level will be deleted.

You can choose to automatically approve comments not marked as spam. This means comments not marked as spam will show up immediately on your site.

This plugin uses asynchronous processing of comments to improve quality of results and to speed up the user interaction. While pending results they will be marked as blue in the admin page. Defensio automatically sends updates as they are ready. However, just in case, the plugin checks every 5 minutes for updates as well.
